HDG.LOG.content: unconcealing of concealed into unconcealment is very presencing of what is present: we call this [who is we?] Being of beings > expression (Ausdruck) & signification (Bedeutung) characteristics of language but don’t genuinely reach into realm of primordial, not capable of determining this realm in its primary characteristics (anfänglichen Wesensprägung) > man never astonished by event (Ereignis) that covers over primary meaning of Sprache, didn’t discern in it mystery (Geheimnis) to discover essential dispensation (Schickung) of Being to men

HDG.LOG.linkedContent: Heraclitus: en does/does not want to be called by name Zeus [can’t we say the same for Being?]

HDG.LOG.content: en as Zeus [as legein?] [?] > [Zeus: highest present being—not Being???] > to name, to call forward, that which is laid down/gathered in name comes to light [Zeus as the dispatcher, lightning bolt as sending, of gathering]

HDG.LOG.content: thinking changes the world, changes world in ever darker depths of a riddle (Rätsel) > riddle propounded (zugesagt) to us [for a long time] in word “Being” > Being remains only the provisional (vorläufige) word [Being originally called “presencing (Anwesen),” enduring-here-before in unconcealment (her-vor-währen in die Unverborgenheit)] [truth and security, Wahrheit]

HDG.IM.content: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision

HDG.IM.content: we stand w/in a language that made Being a mere word, if we call it a fact, this is a provisional formulation [Vorläufigkeit] > still have not thought through, still coming to grips w/ this “fact” [so Nietzsche didn’t think it through?]

HDG.BC.content: “Ground-concepts” calls us to come to stand where a footing & a permanence are granted, where all decisions are made, but also where indecisiveness borrows its hiding places [relate to Derrida, undecidable]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.BC.linkedContent: “Ground-concepts” calls us to come to stand where a footing & a permanence are granted, where all decisions are made, but also where indecisiveness borrows its hiding places [relate to Derrida, undecidable]

HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.BC.content: [do we belong anywhere at all?] to merely anticipate (ahnen) where we could belong: necessary to experience ourselves: “ourselves” re: what determines us, is other than us, but governs us [totally other?]: (we call this arbitrarily at first [willkürlich zunächst]) the inception of our history

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: [do we belong anywhere at all?] to merely anticipate (ahnen) where we could belong: necessary to experience ourselves: “ourselves” re: what determines us, is other than us, but governs us [totally other?]: (we call this arbitrarily at first [willkürlich zunächst]) the inception of our history

HDG.BC.content: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]

HDG.BC.content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.LA.content: what is so bidden is commanded to arrive from out of the dif-ference into the dif-ference > primal calling, nature of speaking, authentic bidding

HDG.LA.linkedContent: what is so bidden is commanded to arrive from out of the dif-ference into the dif-ference > primal calling, nature of speaking, authentic bidding

HDG.LA.content: dif-ference gathers the 2 out of itself as it calls them into the rift that is the dif-ference itself > dif-ference as peal of silence [?]

HDG.LA.linkedContent: dif-ference gathers the 2 out of itself as it calls them into the rift that is the dif-ference itself > dif-ference as peal of silence [?]

HDG.TB.content: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.TB.linkedContent: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

HDG.WM.content: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WM.linkedContent: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]

HDG.WM.content: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

HDG.IWM.content: truth of Being called ground, that which nourishes root of tree of philosophy (i.e. metaphysics) > in the ground, roots forget themselves for sake of tree > philosophy doesn’t gather itself upon its ground, always leaves (never escapes) its ground, by means of metaphysics

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: truth of Being called ground, that which nourishes root of tree of philosophy (i.e. metaphysics) > in the ground, roots forget themselves for sake of tree > philosophy doesn’t gather itself upon its ground, always leaves (never escapes) its ground, by means of metaphysics

HDG.IWM.content: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]

HDG.IWM.content: fundamental ontology (attempt to inquire back), like any title, soon seen to be inappropriate [beyond Being then?], misleading because says something correct from point of view of metaphysics > what matters is undertaking transition [not there yet] from metaphysics to recalling truth of Being > thinking that calls itself “fundamental ontology” blocks/obscures its own path by very designation > attempt to recall truth of Being, going back into ground of metaphysics [Destruction], already left realm of all ontology w/ 1st step [was that step ever taken?] > wherever indirect/direct representation of “transcendence” remains: ontology [cf. On The Essence of Ground p. 125] [cf. OG pp. 22-3]

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: fundamental ontology (attempt to inquire back), like any title, soon seen to be inappropriate [beyond Being then?], misleading because says something correct from point of view of metaphysics > what matters is undertaking transition [not there yet] from metaphysics to recalling truth of Being > thinking that calls itself “fundamental ontology” blocks/obscures its own path by very designation > attempt to recall truth of Being, going back into ground of metaphysics [Destruction], already left realm of all ontology w/ 1st step [was that step ever taken?] > wherever indirect/direct representation of “transcendence” remains: ontology [cf. On The Essence of Ground p. 125] [cf. OG pp. 22-3]

HDG.QB.content: essence of nihilism can never be decided by judiciary of ratio, which unthinkingly thrusts everything inappropriate to it into alleged mire of irrational (a mire it itself first delimits) > reason & its representational activity only one kind of thinking, not self-determined, determined by that which called upon thinking to think in the manner of ratio [i.e. essence of ratio not ratio] [cf. Gay Science 111] > domination of ratio (leveling out/standardization) accompanied by attempts to flee into irrational

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of nihilism can never be decided by judiciary of ratio, which unthinkingly thrusts everything inappropriate to it into alleged mire of irrational (a mire it itself first delimits) > reason & its representational activity only one kind of thinking, not self-determined, determined by that which called upon thinking to think in the manner of ratio [i.e. essence of ratio not ratio] [cf. Gay Science 111] > domination of ratio (leveling out/standardization) accompanied by attempts to flee into irrational

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: crossing through (Durchkreuzung) not merely negative sign of a crossing out: X as four regions of fourfold > human essence belongs, in X of Being, to that which takes thinking into claim of a more originary call [e.g. X Being would imply replacement w/ Ereignis]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: crossing through (Durchkreuzung) not merely negative sign of a crossing out: X as four regions of fourfold > human essence belongs, in X of Being, to that which takes thinking into claim of a more originary call [e.g. X Being would imply replacement w/ Ereignis]

HDG.QB.content: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.QB.linkedContent: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

HDG.QB.content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.QB.linkedContent: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

HDG.FS.content: kosmos, not the largest in which all finds their space, not space [world? via Diels] but way of being: Zier (adornment): radiance/gleam/Zeus > kosmeō: bring into an order > “world,” immediately calls to mind idea of great Whole, lead to Kantian “cosmology,” then space expeditions (cosmonauts)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: kosmos, not the largest in which all finds their space, not space [world? via Diels] but way of being: Zier (adornment): radiance/gleam/Zeus > kosmeō: bring into an order > “world,” immediately calls to mind idea of great Whole, lead to Kantian “cosmology,” then space expeditions (cosmonauts)

HDG.FS.content: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick

HDG.FS.content: how same expression can move from metaphysical to non-metaphysical language: 1) inner illumination (innere Erleuchtung), being itself announces itself (sich bekundet), that Dasein unfolds (ausbildet) ein “Seinsverständnis,” Seinsfrage in Sein und Zeit calls for a renewal (Erneuerung) of language 2) favorable external conditions: a) decline (Verfall) and impoverishment (Verarmung) of language [compare to rich language of brothers Grimm] b) fixing of language in computer calculation stops its natural growth

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.FS.linkedContent: how same expression can move from metaphysical to non-metaphysical language: 1) inner illumination (innere Erleuchtung), being itself announces itself (sich bekundet), that Dasein unfolds (ausbildet) ein “Seinsverständnis,” Seinsfrage in Sein und Zeit calls for a renewal (Erneuerung) of language 2) favorable external conditions: a) decline (Verfall) and impoverishment (Verarmung) of language [compare to rich language of brothers Grimm] b) fixing of language in computer calculation stops its natural growth

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)

HDG.CCP.content: thinking understood traditionally, as re-presenting, a kind of willing > like Kant, who calls thinking spontaneity: to think is to will, to will to think

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: thinking understood traditionally, as re-presenting, a kind of willing > like Kant, who calls thinking spontaneity: to think is to will, to will to think

HDG.CCP.content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called

HDG.DL.content: called language, clumsily enough, the house of Being

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.DL.linkedContent: called language, clumsily enough, the house of Being

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY
motif.title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

HDG.DL.linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.DL.content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

HDG.DL.content: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

HDG.DL.content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

HDG.DL.content: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

HDG.DL.content: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

HDG.DL.content: grace, Anmut, Greek charis, which is called tiktousa (brings forward & forth), like German word dichten, tihton > graciousness as the poetical, das Quellen der Botschaft des Entbergens der Zwiefalt

HDG.DL.linkedContent: grace, Anmut, Greek charis, which is called tiktousa (brings forward & forth), like German word dichten, tihton > graciousness as the poetical, das Quellen der Botschaft des Entbergens der Zwiefalt

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

HDG.DL.content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.LP.content: [though poetic dialogue only true dialogue] sometimes necessary for there to be a dialogue btwn thinking/poetry: aims to call forth (hervorzurufen) Wesen of Sprache, so mortals can learn to live again w/in language

HDG.LP.content: strange “fremd”: Old High German fram, “forward to somewhere else (anderswohin vorwärts), underway toward (unterwegs nach),” dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen > strange searches for site where can remain in its wandering: barely exposed to itself, still follows the call of the way to its own

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: strange “fremd”: Old High German fram, “forward to somewhere else (anderswohin vorwärts), underway toward (unterwegs nach),” dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen > strange searches for site where can remain in its wandering: barely exposed to itself, still follows the call of the way to its own

HDG.LP.content: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

HDG.LP.content: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)

HDG.LP.content: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

HDG.LP.content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LP.linkedContent: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

HDG.LP.content: Trakl calls unborn “grandsons” because they do not continue decaying generation [Geschlecht], they are another Generation (andere Generation) [sweeping summary in one sentence: pain, vision, flame, look ahead into withdrawing earliness, ghosts]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl calls unborn “grandsons” because they do not continue decaying generation [Geschlecht], they are another Generation (andere Generation) [sweeping summary in one sentence: pain, vision, flame, look ahead into withdrawing earliness, ghosts]

HDG.LP.content: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]

HDG.LP.content: poet only becomes poet as he follows “madman” [stranger], calls to the brother who follows him [?] > friend’s face (Antlizt) looks into face of stranger: Augenblick [instant] of this glance moves the Sage of the listener

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: poet only becomes poet as he follows “madman” [stranger], calls to the brother who follows him [?] > friend’s face (Antlizt) looks into face of stranger: Augenblick [instant] of this glance moves the Sage of the listener

HDG.LP.content: on the Christianity of Trakl: why doesn’t he call out to God/Christ? why does he call instead to “sister’s swaying shadow,” calling her “the greeting one”? > a Lament not about redemption, a lament that urges Sister to look

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LP.linkedContent: on the Christianity of Trakl: why doesn’t he call out to God/Christ? why does he call instead to “sister’s swaying shadow,” calling her “the greeting one”? > a Lament not about redemption, a lament that urges Sister to look

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)

HDG.WL.content: we will call the Sprachwesen in its totality (im Ganzen)—Sage: the Aufriss pervaded (durchzogen) by all modes of saying (eg. the present or absent announces/refuses/shows/withdraws itself)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WL.linkedContent: we will call the Sprachwesen in its totality (im Ganzen)—Sage: the Aufriss pervaded (durchzogen) by all modes of saying (eg. the present or absent announces/refuses/shows/withdraws itself)

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.WL.content: we let the soundless voice come to us, then demand, reach out, call for the sound already kept in store (aufbehaltenen Laut) for us

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WL.linkedContent: we let the soundless voice come to us, then demand, reach out, call for the sound already kept in store (aufbehaltenen Laut) for us

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WL.content: Language has been called “the house of Being (Haus des Seins)”: it is the keeper (Hut) of being present (Anwesens)

HDG.EC.content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.linkedContent: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.content: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.EC.linkedContent: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.EC.linkedContent: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

HDG.OHF.content: a concept points to a forehaving/foreconception (Vorgriff), transports us to a fundamental experience, calls for a how of addressing (Ansprechens)/interrogating: transports (versetzt) us into the being-there of our Dasein (interpretation & worry [Bekümerung]) > fundamental concepts (Grundbegriffe) not later additions to Dasein, sondern vor-tragen (but carry forward, ex-press), grab/point Dasein in their way [auto-affection?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: a concept points to a forehaving/foreconception (Vorgriff), transports us to a fundamental experience, calls for a how of addressing (Ansprechens)/interrogating: transports (versetzt) us into the being-there of our Dasein (interpretation & worry [Bekümerung]) > fundamental concepts (Grundbegriffe) not later additions to Dasein, sondern vor-tragen (but carry forward, ex-press), grab/point Dasein in their way [auto-affection?]

HDG.OHF.content: attention (aufmerksam) should’ve been called to certain difficulty: many directions of philosophy today don’t provide much basis for phenomenological analysis Heidegger is initiating here

HDG.OHF.content: tarrying awhile (Verweilen), even halting on street, holding out in temporality of everydayness, completely different than occurrence of thing called “man” [beyond humanism]

HDG.OHF.content: dialectic, in being negated, doesn’t call for direct grasping (Erfassen)/having [is there having in fundamental phenomenology?]
